# ðŸ’Ž Beaconchain restore requires memory equal to beaconchain db backup file size on disk


### Background

A beaconchain db restore seems to be working entirely in memory. 
The current backup size is 22gb
Last time a backup restore with a 14gb db wouldnt work on an instance with 8gb of ram but worked fine with 16. 
With the 22 gigs, an instance with more RAM than 22GB is needed to restore it. 
Any programmatic changes that allow a restore to work without needing RAM = backup size would be great!  

A minimum viable fix would be to bump the recommended RAM to 32 gigs in the docs :/  

### Description


Example backup for recording the slot this issue was noticed at: 

```
$ ls -al
-rw------- 1 ubuntu ubuntu 21373681664 Apr  2 22:20 prysm_beacondb_at_slot_0880328.backup
```
When running the following command an error was returned: 
CMD:
```
$ ~/prysm$ ./prysm.sh beacon-chain db restore --restore-source-file=/home/ubuntu/prysm/prysm_beacondb_at_slot_0880328.backup
```
Error spotted w/ a 16gb AWS c5.2xlarge instance: 

```
Starting Prysm beacon-chain db restore --restore-source-file=/home/ubuntu/prysm/prysm_beacondb_at_slot_0880328.backup
fatal error: runtime: out of memory

runtime stack:
runtime.throw(0x1a3b36e, 0x16)
```

### Workaround

You can restore the DB on an instance with enough RAM for the backup and then switch the EBS volume to a min spec instance. 

### Incentives
As with all issues filed by sharedstake.org, this one comes with an attached bounty starting at 100SGT for a fix.
